result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee Robert Lucas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bomb Scares [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.015.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Current sentence

superMiscConds.notes: DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment to the extent that it doesn't interfere with Social Security benefits.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with N.R. (person, property, residence or family) unless approved by agent and N.R.  Defendant is not to loiter in any Government courthouse unless he has legal business there.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including psychological evaluation. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

continuing the involuntary administration of fluids, nutrition and medication

Defendant Lee Robert Lucas in court with attorneys Heather L. Johnson and Michael Barth.  Defendant Lee Robert Lucas in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Lansdorf from Corporation Counsel appears for Racine County Sheriff Christopher Schmaling. Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties have received and reviewed the report from the doctor at MMHI. No challenge to the report. Ms. Johnson asks for a status and indicates she will be filing a bond motion as well
The next issue is the defendant's refusal to take in fluids, nutrition and medication. Mr. Lansdorf provided the Court, the State and parties a letter from Dr. Butler. Mr. Lansdorf indicates Dr. Butler feels the continuation of forced fluids, nutrition and medication remain.

BTC: The Court finds the defendant competent to proceed.  The Courts order for involuntary administration of fluids, nutrition and medication continues. If deft's counsel wishes to provide testimony regarding the deft's condition, the Court will give them forum to do so. Mr. Lansdorf to provide an order to the Court.
  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:15 am.

directing involuntary medical evaluation and the administration of care, nutrition, hydration, medication, or treatment.
from Karen Butler/Advanced Correctional Healthcare re: update.
Proposed Order from RCSO. Forwarded to Judge for review/signature.

Attorneys Michael Robert Barth and Heather Johnson in court.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Lansdorf appears on behalf of Sheriff Schmaling. Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Court officer indicates that defendant refused to come to court today. Mr. Barth spoke with Mr. Lucas yesterday and explained the documents he had. Neiher Mr. Barth or Ms. Johnson has not spoken to deft today and has no reason to provide the Court as to why the deft isn't here. The Court is going to recess to give the attorneys leave to go to the jail and convince deft to come down. Mr. Barth indicates that he did speak with deft and deft refuses to cooperate with him today. Mr. Barth asks that deft's appearance be waived. 

The Court has received the report from Dr. Rawski. Parties have reviewed the report and Ms. Johnson has discussed it with Mr. Lucas. Mr. Barth asks that the deft be referred to by initials due to the media being present.

BTC: The Court is satisfied based on this report and the continued request by Ms. Johnson for competency evals along with deft refusing to appear in court. Deft to be transferred a State institute to be evaluated. Request of Mr. Barth is denied. A continuation of the forced nutrition is approp and the Court will continue the order for 30 days unless Dr. Butler has determined it should not be or if deft decides to self nutrate. The Court sees nothing that indicates that the deft is incompetent. The Court reverses its prior ruling to seal all documents and said documents may now unsealed.
from Dr. Rawski. Copies forwarded to all parties.
